III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A alleged Staff 1 touched him inappropriately on 7/13/24.
Investigation On 7/31/24, I emailed Foster Care Worker. She did not provide
any new information.
On 7/31/24, I spoke to Administrator. Administrator was told by
Complainant 1 that Youth A made allegations stating Staff 1
touched him inappropriately. Administrator reported she had
spoken to Youth A. Youth A had recanted his allegation
concerning Staff 1.
On 9/5/24 I spoke to Complainant 1. Complainant 1 did not
provide any new information. Complainant 1 reported he did not
see anything only that Youth A told him the allegations.
On 8/1/24, I spoke to DHHS Worker 1. Allegations and scheduling
were discussed.
Staff 1 was interviewed in conjunction with MDHHS Worker on
8/21/24. Staff 1 reported he was working on the alleged date,
7/13/24 in the Compass Center. Staff 1 reported Youth A was on
the computer and wanted a snack. He was told, “No.” After he was
told this, he then wanted to use the restroom. Staff 1 reported he
took him to use the restroom. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
walking in front of him and passed by the restroom. Staff 1
reported he verbally redirected Youth A to the restroom. After
Youth A used the restroom, Youth A went back to his computer.
Staff 1 reported he never touched Youth A. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
was working with him that day.
The following interviews were completed onsite on 9/5/24:
Youth A reported he was at the Compass Center on 7/13/24.
Youth A reported he has never been supervised by Staff 1 and
has never been touched by Staff 1 in any manner.
2

Staff 2 reported he worked at the Compass Center on 7/13/24.
Staff 2 reported he did not see Staff 1 do anything inappropriate
with Youth A. Staff 2 reported he never saw Staff 1 touch Youth A
in any manner.
Video Reviewed:
• There is no video of the incident.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file. All clearances and trainings were
up to date. Staff 1 did not have any disciplinary action in his
file.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate the allegations that Staff 1
inappropriately touched Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
